title: Teaching
text:
ECON 3102: Intermediate Macroeconomics


Semester: Summer, 2024


University of Minnesota (TA)


Determinants of national income, employment, and price level; effects of monetary and fiscal policies; emphasis on a general equilibrium approach.






ECON 3101: Intermediate Microeconomics


Semester: Summer, 2024


University of Minnesota (TA)


Behavior of households, firms, and industries under competitive/monopolistic conditions.






ECON 1102: Principles of Macroeconomics


Semester: Spring, 2024


University of Minnesota (TA)


Aggregate consumption, saving, investment, and national income. Role of money, banking, and business cycles in domestic and world economy.






ECON 1101: Principles of Microeconomics


Semester: Fall, 2023


University of Minnesota (TA)


Microeconomic behavior of consumers, firms, and markets in domestic and world economy






MATH 2552: Differential Equations


Semester: Fall, 2022


Georgia Tech (TA)


Methods for obtaining numerical and analytic solutions of elementary differential equations. Applications are also discussed with an emphasis on modeling.






MATH 2550: Introduction to Multivariable Calculus


Semester: Spring, 2022


Georgia Tech (TA)


An introduction to multivariable calculus through vectors in 3D, curves, functions of several variables, partial derivatives, min/max problems, multiple integration.

title: Research
text:
Working Papers
“Work from home, polarization, and new residential construction during COVID-19” (joint with Dylan Brewer)

title: Graham Lewis
text:
I am a second year PhD student at the University of Minnesota. My current research focuses are on labor economics and inequality.
I graduated from the Georgia Institute of Technology, where I double-majored in economics and mathematics with a minor in Chinese.
If you have any questions about my research or want to reach out, I’d love to talk to you! Feel free to reach out via email (lewi1837 at umn dot edu)


PhD in Economics | University of Minnesota
BS in Economics & Mathematics | Georgia Tech | 2022

title: Graham Lewis
text:
